Trial_Design.evidence: This cohort study was a single-arm phase 2 trial

Participants.evidence: patients with high-risk, pMMR rectal cancer

Intervention.evidence: Participants received 3 cycles of induction oxaliplatin and capecitabine combined with camrelizumab and radiotherapy (50.6 Gy in 22 fractions) with concurrent capecitabine.

Objective.evidence: To evaluate the safety and efficacy of TNT with induction chemoimmunotherapy followed by long-course chemoradiation in patients with high-risk, pMMR rectal cancer

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary end point was pathologic complete response rate.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The pathologic complete response rate was 33.3% (7/21).

Harms.evidence: The most common adverse event was nausea (80%, 20/25); grade 3 toxic effects occurred in 9 of 25 patients (36%).
